title: Kishor Piraji Kharat takes charge as MD & CEO of IDBI Bank
text: Kishor Piraji Kharat takes charge as MD & CEO of IDBI Bank By Saikat Das , ET Bureau | 17 Aug, 2015, 09.27PM IST ET SPECIAL: Love visual aspect of news? Enjoy this exclusive slideshows treat! MUMBAI: Kishor Piraji Kharat has assumed charge as managing director & chief executive director of IDBI Bank with effect from August 14, 2015. He was earlier posted as executive director of Union Bank of India. Kharat is a graduate in commerce and law, and is a certified associate of the Indian Institute of Bankers. He also holds an Executive Diploma in Management. Before Union Bank of India , Kharat had served Bank of Baroda for three decades. Kharat has dealt with various verticals of banking including credit, international business, information technology and general administration both in India as well as overseas. During the April-June quarter, IDBI Bank reported a 27% rise in net profit to Rs 135 crore aided by a steep rise in its non-interest income- trading profits and fees levied to customers. But, the new bank boss has an arduous task to deliver when it comes to the bank's share of bad loans, which borrowers defaulted. Gross bad loans or non-performing assets expanded 31% to Rs 14,112 crore from Rs 10,763.4 crore a year ago. Net NPAs were at Rs 6,496 crore versus Rs 5291crore earlier, up 23%. IDBI Bank shares on Monday rose 4.5% to close at Rs 70.65 on BSE.
